description: A group of 23 bilingual municipalities asked a Quebec Superior Court judge on Monday to suspend several portions of the province’s 2022 language reform, arguing that the application of the law will cause them serious and irreparable harm. Lawyer Julius Grey told the Montreal courtroom that the law contains measures that will have “enormous consequences” […]
title: 23 Bilingual Municipalities Ask Judge to Suspend Portions of Quebec Language Law

description: It took six weeks for then-Public Safety Minister Bill Blair to approve electronic surveillance of an Ontario politician, leading to frustration within the Canadian Security Intelligence Service (CSIS), the Foreign Interference Commission has learned. Officials from CSIS testified on the matter before the Foreign Interference Commission on Sept. 27, saying the delay was unusual. “We […]
title: CSIS Frustrated by Delay in Minister’s Approval of Wiretap on Ontario Politician: Former Official

description: Coastal views of Pingtung County of Taiwan before the arrival of Typhoon Krathon on Sept. 30, which is likely to make an unusual landfall on the island’s west coast on the afternoon of Oct. 1, according to the island’s Central Weather Administration.
title: Taiwan Braces for Intensifying Typhoon Krathon

description: Four in five Canadians are concerned about false information affecting the next federal election, while many also fear foreign actors exploiting social media to influence opinions, according to an Elections Canada-commissioned survey. The survey, which was delivered to the agency in April and first covered covered by Blacklock’s Reporter, asked 2,501 Canadians whether they thought […]
title: Two-Thirds of Canadians Concerned About Foreign Influence Through Social Media: Elections Canada Survey

description: Commentary Last week’s threat by Bloc Québécois Leader Yves-François Blanchet to withdraw support from the government has attracted more publicity than it deserves. He declared that the Bloc would try to bring down the Liberal government in Parliament if it did not back the Bloc’s bills to increase pension benefits for those between 65 and […]
title: Conrad Black: It’s Time to Determine Once and for All if Canada Wishes to Be One Nation or Two

description: Shigeru Ishiba, set to be approved for prime minister on Oct. 1, has sought to strengthen ties with Taiwan amid CCP's aggression in the Indo-Pacific.
title: Incoming Japanese PM Calls for Early General Election on Oct. 27 Amid China Tensions

description: Reports emerged on Sept. 30 that Israeli special operations forces had entered a tunnel system inside Lebanon.
title: US Aware of ‘Limited Operations’ by Israeli Forces Inside Lebanon: State Department

description: Populations are being subjected to cognitive attacks that leverage a combination of psychology and new technologies, a former Canadian spy boss has warned, identifying China and Russia as key perpetrators. David Vigneault, former director of the Canadian Security Intelligence Service (CSIS), delved into “cognitive warfare” while testifying before the Foreign Interference Commission on Sept. 27. […]
title: Canada’s Ex-Spy Boss Warns of ‘Cognitive Warfare’ Tactics Being Used by China, Russia

description: Some senators appointed by Prime Minister Justin Trudeau are criticizing a Bloc Québécois bill on dairy quotas, which the party has said is a requirement for it to continue supporting the Liberal government on non-confidence votes. Bill C-282, An Act To Amend The Department Of Foreign Affairs Act, makes dairy, poultry, and egg quotas non-negotiable […]
title: Trudeau-Appointed Senators Question Bill Bloc Wants Passed to Support Liberals

description: MPs and campaigners opposing new pylons have suggested that underground transmission lines are a cheaper alternative.

description: The Russian defense ministry's claim coincides with the two-year anniversary of its effective annexation of four regions of eastern and southeastern Ukraine.

description: Fellow Tory leader candidate James Cleverly called for defence spending to be increased to 3 percent, and said that the NHS doesn't need more money, but reform.

description: Old-fashioned baby names continue to top charts in Canada year-after-year as parents seek inspiration from days gone by in naming their children. description: The Freedom Party, which takes a hardline stance on immigration and promotes remigration policies, is struggling to find coalition offers to form a government.

description: Nearly 50 percent of Canadians would support calling a federal election before next fall, a new national survey suggests. Thirty-two percent of Canadians are ready to head to the ballot box as soon as possible while 16 percent would prefer an election to happen sooner than October 2025 but not before the end of this […]
title: Nearly Half of Canadians Want an Early Election: Survey

description: Phasing out coal power is part of the government's net zero strategy to minimise the carbon footprint of power plants.
title: Last Coal-Fired Power Plant Ceases Production in Port Talbot

description: The union representing longshore workers at the Port of Montreal began a three-day strike at two terminals. description: Experts attribute an increasing number of patients to economic uncertainty, social isolation, and overwhelming exposure to news and social media.

description: New York's first mayor in its near 400-year history is indicted on federal charges.

description: Copenhagen introduced a scheme in 2018 to alter certain residential zones, including tearing down social housing to disperse residents.
title: Denmark Faces Accusations of Racism Over Anti-Ghetto Policy at EU Court

description: ATHENS, Greece—Two people died overnight in a large wildfire burning through forestland in Greece near a seaside resort in the country’s south, authorities said Monday. description: The ONS now thinks that the economy grew by 0.5 percent in the second quarter of 2024, down from a previous estimate of 0.6 percent.
title: UK Economy Shows Weaker Than Expected Growth Over Spring

description: LONDON—U.S. citizen Stephen James Hubbard pleaded guilty in a Moscow court on Monday to charges of mercenary activity, admitting that he had received money to fight for Ukraine against Russia, the RIA state news agency reported. “Yes, I agree with the indictment,” RIA cited him as saying. Hubbard, 72, was placed in pre-trial detention last […]

description: Prosecutors say one of the defendants, Thierry Legier, drew a salary as a parliamentary assistant but was a  bodyguard to Le Pen and her father Jean-Marie.

description: He may not have logged the fastest time or even gone the full distance, but residents of a Newfoundland town agree the goat who unexpectedly joined the local weekend half marathon was the event’s undisputed champion. description: Biden’s approval came as Taiwan was on heightened alert due to the recent firings by the CCP’s Rocket Force and army in inland China.

description: Experts express their concern after a recent survey revealed notable nicotine pouch use amongst young Australians amid the current vape crackdown.

description: The surplus is estimated to have been generated largely due to two major reforms in NDIS and aged care policies.

description: After firing a missile to within 700 kilometres of French Polynesia, Beijing has now invited a delegation from the small Pacific nation on a state visit.

description: Parts of a British Columbia Interior community is under tactical evacuation due to the threat of a nearby wildfire. description: Chalmers is set to reveal the budget later today.

description: VIENNA—Austrian voters handed a first-ever general election victory to the right-wing Freedom Party on Sunday, preliminary results showed. The Head of Freedom Party (FPO) held a slim lead in opinion polls for months over Chancellor Karl Nehammer’s ruling Austrian People’s Party (OVP) in a campaign dominated by immigration and worries about the economy. Led by […]
title: Right-Wing Party Wins Austria Election, Preliminary Results Show
